title: Question about Illaoi's God, & her Idol.

replies.body: The Eye of God as it's called allows Illaoi to function as the truth bearer; it's not an idol of worship but an instrument of Nagakabouros's power.

+1. 
It is rare,  but it is only a "tool."   Like a hammer or saw.   It would be replaced.  The power comes from her connection to Nagakabouros, the Eye of God just helps her focus.

OH! So like Cyclops with his Visors then?
I see now. It's not an Idol, but an instrument made to help spread her teachings even better.
Basically how clerics function in D&D. They need a divine symbol to channel the power of their God, but the object itself is mundane. Right?
Nagakabouros would probably be proud to have it's visage used in this manner
If I were a god, I would certainly enjoy people getting smacked in the face with something in my visage, equating it to ownage.

I think that it's just a difference in how the religion is put together. Christianity is a community-oriented religion, so it needs a strong central figurehead to unite that community; with that in mind, it has a lot of built-in reverence for images of Jesus. Illaoi's religion, on the other hand is much more individually focused; because of that, it's all about the individual's relationship with Nagakabouros. If that relationship doesn't require reverence for a physical object, so be it.

> [{quoted}](name=Stand Alone Wolf,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=Go5ya3eE,comment-id=,timestamp=2015-11-25T10:46:02.561+0000)
>
> Okay, I'm not a religious nut, nor do I feel some negative way about this, but If she worships her God Nagakabouros, then why is she captain morganin on an Idol of him? Wouldn't that upset him?
> Would you perch your foot on an Idol of Jesus on the cross?
> It's a question I didn't think about until after I bought her, & started studying her moves, & a good build for her. Is there something I'm not seeing? If so, please explain. {{champion:420}}


judging by her in game quotes, this isnt a typical god. it actually doesnt care for worship nor does it care if you praise it, it only cares that you fight. it is pretty much a god of war but doesnt care for servants.
